abstract.text: Available scene-understanding options.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

abstract.text: Simulate and render 3D content for use in your augmented reality apps.
A view that enables you to display an AR experience with RealityKit.
A description of background, lighting, and acoustic properties for a
view’s content.
An object that holds scene-understanding options for the view.
Available scene-understanding options.
The type of the elements of an array literal.
The element type of the option set.
The raw type that can be used to represent all values of the conforming
type.
The
option means that the reconstructed geometry can be used for collision queries (i.e. raycasting)
The
options is a sentinel value that indicates the user wants whatever scene-understanding features
work with the current device and are supported. It overrides other options in the options set.
Creates a new option set from the given raw value.
The
option means that the reconstructed geometry will be used for rendering,
but only to update the depth buffer. Parts of virtual objects which are
behind the reconstructed geometry are not rendered.
No abstract
The corresponding value of the raw type.
The
option means that the virtual lights will interact with real world surfaces
causing them to shine. The properties  of the mesh will be set to a default material.
A specification that detects and reacts to features of the physical
environment.
A component that specifies an entity is participating in the system’s scene-understanding features.
Detect objects in an AR scene or create a detailed 3D reconstruction of the real-world environment.

doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation.title: Implementing scene understanding and reconstruction in your RealityKit app

abstract.text: The object that manages the major tasks associated with every AR experience, such as motion tracking, camera passthrough, and image analysis.
A flag that enables scene reconstruction.
Checks if the device supports scene reconstruction.
A source of live data about the shape of a person’s surroundings.
Estimate the shape of the physical environment using a polygonal mesh.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Visualizing and interacting with a reconstructed scene

abstract.text: Create AR games and experiences that interact with real-world objects on LiDAR-equipped iOS devices.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Creating a game with scene understanding

abstract.text: A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type that can be converted to and from an associated raw value.
A type that provides mathematical set operations.
A type that can be initialized using an array literal.
A type that presents a mathematical set interface to a bit set.
